definition: to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off

to cover/to encase/cover/sheath/to overlap/to interleave/to model after/to copy/formula/harness/loop of rope/(fig.) to fish for/to obtain slyly/classifier for sets, collections/bend (of a river or mountain range, in place names)/tau (Greek letter Ττ)

sentences.english: He is just a small-time actor.
sentences.chinese: 他不過是個跑龍套的演員。

sentences.english: When the young man went to college, he decided to try out for the football team as a "walk-on."
sentences.chinese: 轉眼少年進了大學，決心拼進校隊，跑龍套也歡喜。

sentences.english: He started his acting career as an extra.
sentences.chinese: 他剛開始演戲時是一個跑龍套的。

sentences.english: To sing in the brother walk-on work.
sentences.chinese: 裏給唱歌的哥哥跑龍套的工作。

sentences.english: Why will not Ron run while Wayne runs?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼當韋恩跑龍套跑的時候，羅恩不跑呢？

sentences.english: He just walked on in the last act in this play.
sentences.chinese: 他只是在這部戲的最後一幕跑龍套。

obscure and unknown (idiom); an outsider without any reputation/a nobody/an unknown quantity
not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties
lit. an easy drive on a familiar path (idiom); fig. experience makes progress easy/a task that is so familiar one can do it with one's hand tied behind one's back
